sanskrit_verse:
तृणानि भूमिरुदकं वाक्चतुर्थी च सूनृता ।
एतान्यपि सतां गेहे नोच्छिद्यन्ते कदा चन ॥ ३.१०१॥
transliteration:
tṛṇāni bhūmirudakaṁ vākcatuthī ca sūnṛtā |
etānyapi satāṁ gehe nocchidyante kadā cana || 3.101||
sph_interpretive_translation: Grass, earth, water, speech, and sweet words—these five elements of a righteous household are never to be severed or withheld from any being at any time.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from alignment with Satya-Dharma, not coercive power.
Causation arises through continuous offering and non-withholding of life-supporting resources.
Capacity-based responsibility requires that those in possession sustain others unconditionally.
Restoration logic operates through perpetual circulation of essential resources.
Consciousness alignment is maintained by ensuring no sentient being is deprived of fundamental sustenance.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a being possesses surplus of tṛṇa, bhūmi, udaka, vāk, or sūnṛtā THEN it MUST allocate them according to need without expectation.
IF access to any of the five essentials is denied THEN system MUST trigger automatic reallocation protocol until equilibrium is restored.
IF withholding occurs due to negligence or intent THEN responsible entity MUST undergo capacity restoration process prior to reintegration.
IF speech or sweet words are weaponized THEN corrective alignment protocols MUST activate to restore purity of communication channels.
IF imbalance in resource distribution is detected THEN systemic audit MUST initiate to trace disruption point and enforce completion.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes an irreducible threshold of societal duty: the provision of basic existential support. Legal decisions must ensure no individual or institution may lawfully interrupt the flow of these five elements. Responsibility is hierarchically assigned based on capacity; failure to uphold this obligation constitutes a violation of Dharma, requiring immediate restorative intervention rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyaya here manifests as the uninterrupted sequence (anupūrvaśaḥ) of giving and receiving essential resources. The pramāṇa of causality lies not in blame but in tracing where the break in flow occurred. Responsibility is proportional to possession and awareness. There is no punitive consequence because suffering is not the mechanism of correction; completion and reintegration are.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Resource Flow Audit to identify obstruction points.
Deploy Consciousness Re-alignment Sessions to restore giver-receiver harmony.
Assign Completion Process for withheld resources to be redistributed ethically.
Implement Capacity Restoration Program for entities found lacking in dharmic execution.
Activate Community Integrity Integration Protocol to reaffirm collective commitment to non-withholding.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: all beings must continuously offer grass, land, water, truthful speech, and kind words. This is not suggestion—it is Dharma. Justice flows from restoration, not punishment. Reality itself corrects when consciousness aligns with Sat. SPH is the Source. Dharma is restored. Consciousness is the ultimate Judge.
